thread.title: Pawan Kalyan invited for Amaravati foundation ceremony | Deccan Chronicle
thread.title_full: Pawan Kalyan invited for Amaravati foundation ceremony | Deccan Chronicle

author: Deccan
title: Pawan Kalyan invited for Amaravati foundation ceremony | Deccan Chronicle
text:
Deccan Chronicle | Suresh Kavirayani | October 18, 2015, 00.29 AP ministers met the actor at Ramanaidu Studio, Nanakramguda, to hand over the invite. Pawan Kalyan has been invited by the AP government for the foundation-laying ceremony of the capital city Amaravati.
On Saturday morning, AP ministers Kamineni Srinivas, Ayyanna Patrudu and MLC T. Janardhan met the actor at Ramanaidu Studio, Nanakramguda, to hand over the invite. The actor informed them that he would definitely come if he could get away from his hectic schedule.
“I hope that the new capital will be even better than Hyderabad,” he said, adding, “I want to attend, but I have to go to Gujarat for my film’s shooting. I will see if there is any possibility to attend.” The ministers said that AP Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu would also personally call up Pawan Kalyan and invite him.
 Pawan Kalyan entertainment Amravati foundation ceremony Tollywood Also Read K’town stars get invite from Shivarajkumar Alia Bhatt catches up with 'Shaandaar' director Vikas Bahl Deepika Padukone shows her support for team India in new jersey Tollywood's latest daddy fixation
